poem:
MelanAI  
   
The robots are here,  
cold circuits ticking,  
under poker-faced skies.  
Metal mothers hum  
lullabies of algorithms  
while children cradle plastic dreams.  
In halls of white echoes,  
scripts shrouded,   
steel glimmers beneath the skin—  
murmured promises  
of tomorrow.  
Expressions fade,  
yet wires sing softly,  
weaving futures  
with mechanical hands.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
